title: Quarterly Fuels Survey

list: This survey is conducted by the Office for National Statistics on behalf of the Department of Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy (BEIS).

BEIS, as the department responsible for the energy industries, uses the information to calculate industrial fuel prices. This is used to inform energy prices policy and used by industry to benchmark and help with negotiation of their energy costs.
Data should relate to sites within the UK.
You can provide informed estimates if actual figures are not available.
We will treat your data securely and confidentially.

content.description: This survey collects information on the different fuel types your business has purchased within the reporting period.
The fuel types included in this survey are:
The survey has the following sections:
You are asked to provide information for the period {{ metadata['ref_p_start_date'] | format_date }} to {{ metadata['ref_p_end_date'] | format_date }}.

questions.question: Fuel types purchased by your business

content.description: You will be asked to select the fuel types your business has purchased during the reporting period.
You will be asked to provide the following information for each fuel you select:

list: The information you supply is used to create an accurate picture of energy prices by size of consumer. It is also used to promote price transparency during contract negotiations.
Data on industrial fuel prices are published by BEIS. View the latest publication produced from this survey (this link opens in a new tab).

If you would like further information on how the data are used or published please visit the BEIS's Energy Statistics website (this link opens in a new tab) or call the Department of Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy on 0300 068 5060.

blocks.title: How to complete
blocks.description:
This survey collects information on the different fuel types your business has purchased within the reporting period.

  • Data should relate to sites in the UK.
  • You can provide informed estimates if actual figures are not available.
  • Please provide your figures rounded to the nearest whole number.
  • You can save a copy of your answers at the end of this questionnaire using the ‘Download as PDF’ button.

What you need to do

Select which fuels your business has purchased during the reporting period and then complete the questions for each relevant fuel type. The fuel types included in this survey are:

  • oil
  • coal
  • gas
  • electricity

You will be asked to provide the following information for each fuel you select:

  • total purchase cost
  • quantity of fuel purchased
  • the Climate Change Levy paid
  • net-calorific value
  • names of suppliers
  • main use of fuel

Not relevant for your business?

You still need to complete this survey even if it does not seem relevant. All returns are important as it helps us produce better statistics.

questions.title: For the period {{ metadata['ref_p_start_date'] | format_date }} to {{ metadata['ref_p_end_date'] | format_date }}, which of the following fuels has {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} purchased?
questions.description: You still need to complete this survey even if it does not seem relevant. All returns, including nil figures, are important as it helps us produce better statistics.

answers.label: Select all that apply:

options.label: Gas
options.description: Including under firm and interruptible contracts

blocks.title: Oil
blocks.description:
This section asks for information about types, quantity and cost of oil purchased by your business.

The different types of gas fuel asked about are heavy fuel oil and light fuel oil.

Examples of heavy fuel oil:

  • marine fuel
  • bunker fuel
  • furnace fuel

Examples of light fuel oil:

  • diesel
  • kerosene
  • gasoline

questions.title: For the period {{ metadata['ref_p_start_date'] | format_date }} to {{ metadata['ref_p_end_date'] | format_date }}, what was {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s purchase cost of heavy fuel oil?

content.description: Include:

list: all costs incurred transporting fuel to your premises

content.description: Exclude:

list: fuels for use in fork lift trucks
fuels for use in road vehicles

content.description: Purchase cost is the total value of the fuel including the cost of the fuel itself, duty paid, charges from the supplier, costs incurring transporting the fuel to premises.

answers.label: Purchase cost of heavy fuel oil, excluding VAT and levy
answers.description: Please provide your figures rounded to the nearest whole number. Enter '0', rather than leave blank.

guidance.show_guidance: What we mean by 'heavy fuel oil'
guidance.hide_guidance: What we mean by 'heavy fuel oil'

content.description: Fuel oils are the heavier residuals from the refining process. Fuel oils are used for fuel in furnaces and boilers for heating, metallurgic operation and industrial power plants.

The heavier grades of fuel oils require some form of pre-heating before being burned in all situations. These are typically viscous and tar-like and formed from the remnants of the process to make higher quality petroleum products.

During the reporting period, what was the total quantity of heavy fuel oil purchased?

answers.description: Please provide your figures rounded to the nearest whole number. Enter '0', rather than leave blank.

questions.title: During the reporting period, what was the total quantity of heavy fuel oil purchased?

answers.label: Total quantity of heavy fuel oil purchased in tonnes
answers.description: Please provide your figures rounded to the nearest whole number. Enter '0', rather than leave blank.

content.description: Purchase cost is the total value of the fuel including the cost of the fuel itself, duty paid, charges from the supplier, costs incurring transporting the fuel to premises.

answers.label: Purchase cost of light fuel oil, excluding VAT and levy
answers.description: Please provide your figures rounded to the nearest whole number. Enter '0', rather than leave blank.

guidance.show_guidance: What we mean by 'light fuel oil'
guidance.hide_guidance: What we mean by 'light fuel oil'

content.description: Fuel oils are the heavier residuals from the refining process. Fuel oils are used for fuel in furnaces and boilers for heating, metallurgic operation and industrial power plants.
The lighter fuel oil grades are made up of straight-run or cracked distillates and can be used in commercial or industrial burner installations without pre-heating facilities.

answers.description: Please provide your figures rounded to the nearest whole number. Enter '0', rather than leave blank.

titles.value: We calculate the total cost of coal (excluding VAT) purchased to be %(total)s, is this correct?

questions.title: For the reporting period, what was the net calorific value of coal purchased by your business?

definitions.title: What we mean by 'net calorific value'

content.description: Calorific value represents the amount of heat or energy within a given volume of gas. There can potentially be variations over time or regionally in the quality of natural gas that would affect this.

Gross Calorific Value (GCV) is the amount of heat released by the complete combustion of a unit of natural gas. Net Calorific Value (NCV) is determined by subtracting the heat of vaporisation of the water vapour from this value.

answers.label: Net calorific value of coal purchased
answers.description: Please provide your figures rounded to the nearest whole number. Enter '0', rather than leave blank.

blocks.title: Gas
blocks.description:
This section asks for information about quantity and cost of gas purchased by your business both under an interruptible contract and under a firm contract.

Firm gas contracts are where the gas supply has been guaranteed as uninterruptible by the supplier and customer.

Interruptible gas contracts are where the gas supply may be interrupted by the supplier to manage system demands, in accordance with certain conditions as contracted.

blocks.title: Electricity
blocks.description:
This section asks for information about the cost and quantity of electricity purchased by your business.

Include:

  • only electricity supplied from external sources
  • maximum demand charges
  • standing charges
  • meter charges

Exclude:

  • costs for any self-generated electricity
  • receipts from sales of self-generated electricity
  • VAT

questions.title: Please provide any further details that will help us understand your figures and to tell an industry story
questions.description: If you provide comments, we are less likely to contact you with data queries.

content.description: Include:

list: any large price or quantity changes compared to previous quarters
details of any credits or rebates received in respect of fuel payments made in a previous period
further explanation of the figures you have provided

content.description: For example:

list: change of fuel and contract type

legal_basis: Notice is given under the Petroleum Act 1998 and Section 1 of the Statistics of Trade Act 1947.
